gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: [UNDER REVIEW] SediLITHO@SEA, lithological descriptions of marine sediments in the Belgian part of the North Sea

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Dataset composed of the following sources: Lars Kint, Vera Van Lancker, Michel Kapel (2018). Sediment cores and lithologies (TILES WFS). Lars Kint, Vera Van Lancker, Sytze van Heteren (2018). TILES Data portal.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Collection of data, data sourcing, evolved from individual scientists associated to scientific institutes, national geological services and universities with a common interest in marine science to project-based sampling campaigns commissioned by authorities or universities, enriched with confidential data exploration coming from private companies and the industry. Given the different origins of the data, as well as the timespan covered, harmonisation and standardisation were a necessity. To stimulate a coherent mapping throughout Europe, guidelines were established (e.g., EU-FP7 Geo-Seas for geological and geophysical data; EU-FP7 SeaDataNet for oceanographic data). The geological data are separated in descriptive lithological entities with numerical estimated sediment values and grain-size distributions. Metadata for both databases are uniform, harmonised and standardised. They include the nomenclature of the boreholes, navigation and positioning system, services like data originator, ships or platforms, sampling gear, analysing method and much more. From the borehole descriptions it was possible to derive main lithology, based on the Wentworth classification (1922); secondary lithology, based on Folk classification (1954); grain-size ranges with related mean, grain-size ratios and percentiles, as well as minor constituents: shell, organic and glauconite content. Coded colour indices and chrono- and/or lithostratigraphic data are also present. A (meta)data quality factor for the positioning, vintage, sampling and analysing was added. The vast majority of the lithological and grain-size data are available in digital format. Newly developed harmonised and standardised borehole information sheets were prepared, and photographic images are all available and fed into a newly developed marine geological data portal for the Belgian part of the North Sea (www.bmdc.be/tiles-dataportal). This database provides detailed information on each of the above steps and a wider historical context of sampling at sea.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: RBINS gives no warranty as to the quality or suitability of the data. Incompleteness, errors or contradictions are possible, uncertainties are sometimes high. Confirmation with further and more recent detailed research is always needed. RBINS is not responsible for further actions done with the data, nor for the consequences of any use whatsoever.
Information is free for use without any application procedure or formalities such as registrations and logins.
